item.description: About me Under the supervision of Professor Valérie Chavez-Demoulin, I graduated in 2016 with a PhD in Statistics from HEC Lausanne with a thesis entitled Generalized Additive Modeling for Multivariate Distributions. As a recipient of a fellowship from the Swiss National Science Foundation, I am now conducting my postdoctoral research in the group of Professor Richard Davis at Columbia University. I am currently working on diverse methodological and applied projects, ranging from solving statistical learning problems using copulas to modeling time-series of counts semiparametrically, and from building high-dimensional risk models for thousands of assets to developing new causal discovery algorithms.
